input_full.title: Generalize /converge skill to accept arbitrary goals/thresholds
input_full.body:
Currently `/converge` is tightly coupled to project-specific QA (SBSTest, GCR, PNT). The eval-fix-rebuild loop pattern is useful for any convergence target -- decouple from project scope and allow arbitrary goal/threshold specification.

---
Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

thinking_blocks.content: The user invoked `/log` without any text. According to the skill definition, this means fully interactive mode - I should prompt for what they want to log.

The user wants to log an idea/feature about generalizing the `/converge` skill. Let me parse this:

- **Type**: This is about improving/enhancing an existing feature - `feature:enhancement`
- **Area**: This is about a skill definition - `area:devtools:skills`
- **Title**: Something like "Generalize /converge skill to accept arbitrary goals/thresholds beyond project-specific QA"

Let me also consider conditional labels:
- Could argue `friction:tooling-gap` since the current design is too restrictive
- `impact:dx` since it improves developer experience

Let me craft the confirmation.

The user sent a paperclip emoji. This is ambiguous - it could mean "attach" something, or it could be a response to my confirmation prompt. Let me interpret this in context. They were presented with [Y] Create, [E] Edit labels, [C] Cancel options. A paperclip doesn't map to any of those.

Let me just ask what they mean.
